name: White Clover
climate: White clover thrives in temperate climates with moderate temperatures.
It can tolerate cold climates, making it suitable for northern regions.
It is less tolerant of extreme heat and dryness, struggling in arid areas.
Areas with moderate rainfall provide ideal growing conditions for white clover.
sunlight: White clover prefers full sun, which promotes optimal growth.
It can thrive in partial shade, particularly during hotter months.
In dense shade, white clover growth can be stunted and sparse.
Balanced sunlight exposure helps maintain its lush green foliage.
watering: White clover requires consistently moist soil but not waterlogged.
Regular watering is essential, especially during dry spells or drought.
Overwatering can lead to fungal diseases, affecting plant health.
Providing enough water helps maintain its vibrant growth and spread.
soil: White clover grows well in loamy soils with good drainage.
It can also adapt to a variety of soil types including clay and sandy.
The soil should be moderately rich in organic matter for best results.
A neutral to slightly acidic pH is ideal for white clover cultivation.
extra_care_tip: White clover can attract bees, so consider this in high-traffic areas.
Periodic mowing can help control its spread and encourage dense growth.
